COMMAND.name: ip access-list

PARAM.name: acl_name
PARAM.help: Specify a IP access-list name, up to 20 characters

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to create IP ACL and then enter IP ACL configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: If the system already has an IP ACL with the same name, this command will enter the IP ACL configuration mode. When the name is not used by any ACL, this command is to create the IP ACL firstly and then enter the IP ACL configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to create an IP ACL named testacl and then enter the IP ACL configuration mode. Switch(config)# ip access-list testacl Switch(config-acl-testacl)#

COMMAND.name: no ip access-list

PARAM.name: acl_name
PARAM.help: Specify a IP access-list name, up to 20 characters

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to remove this IP ACL.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to remove the IP ACL, and should detach IP ACL from the interface which applied this IP ACL.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to remove an IP ACL named testacl. Switch(config)# no ip access-list testacl

COMMAND.name: time-range

PARAM.name: range_name
PARAM.help: Specify a time range name, up to 40 characters

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to create time range and enter time-range configuration mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: A time range is used to determine a range of time during which a filter is effective.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to create a time range with the name 'my-time-range': Switch(config)# time-range my-time-range Switch(config-time-range-my-time-range)#

COMMAND.name: no time-range

PARAM.name: range_name
PARAM.help: Specify a time range name, up to 40 characters

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to delete time range.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to delete a time range with the name 'my-time-range': Switch(config)# no time-range my-time-range

COMMAND.name: do
COMMAND.help: To run exec commands in config mode

COMMAND.name: exit
COMMAND.help: Exit from time range configuration mode

COMMAND.name: quit
COMMAND.help: Exit from time range configuration mode

COMMAND.name: absolute
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to define the absolute time and date in time range.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Comparing with the periodic time, choose an appropriate type.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to define a time range started from 11:20:30 September 28 2016 and ended by 20:30:40 September 30 2016: Switch(config-time-range-my-time-range)# absolute start 11:20:30 sep 28 2016 end 20:30:40 sep 30 2016

COMMAND.name: periodic

PARAM.name: WEEKDAY
PARAM.help: Day of the week(At least first three letters of the weekday)

PARAM.name: end_day
PARAM.help: Day of the week(At least first three letters of the weekday)

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to define the periodic time and date in time range.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Comparing with the absolute time, choose an appropriate type.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to define a time range started from 00:00 Monday and ended by 18:00 Wednesday in weekly period: Switch(config-time-range-my-time-range)# periodic 00:00 mon to 18:00 wed This example shows how to define a time range started from 09:00 and ended by 17:00 everyday: Switch(config-time-range-my-time-range)# periodic 09:00 daily to 17:00

COMMAND.name: do
COMMAND.help: To run exec commands in config mode

COMMAND.name: no
COMMAND.help: Negate a command or set its defaults

COMMAND.name: remark
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to add remarks for the IP ACL.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The remarks are up to 100 characters. The exceed parts will not be stored and will be truncated.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: Default is no remarks of IP ACL.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to add a remark to describe the IP ACL. Switch(config-acl-test)# remark aaaaaa

COMMAND.name: no remark
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to delete remarks for the IP ACL.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: Default is no remarks of IP ACL.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to delete the remark of the IP ACL. Switch(config-acl-test)# no remark

COMMAND.name: GACL

PARAM.name: src_mac
PARAM.help: Source host's MAC address in HHHH.HHHH.HHHH format

PARAM.name: src_mac
PARAM.help: Source host's MAC address in HHHH.HHHH.HHHH format

PARAM.name: dest_mac
PARAM.help: Destination host's MAC address in HHHH.HHHH.HHHH format

PARAM.name: dest_mac
PARAM.help: Destination host's MAC address in HHHH.HHHH.HHHH format

PARAM.name: src_ip_addrlen
PARAM.help: Source IP address with mask length

PARAM.name: dest_ip_addrlen
PARAM.help: Destination IP address with mask length

PARAM.name: dscp
PARAM.help: Match packets with given dscp value

PARAM.name: ip-precedence
PARAM.help: Match packets with given ip-precedencep value

PARAM.name: non-first-fragment
PARAM.help: Match packets with non first fragment

PARAM.name: non-or-first-fragment
PARAM.help: Match packets with non fragment or first fragment

PARAM.name: small-fragment
PARAM.help: Match packets that fragment offset is 1-3

PARAM.name: eq
PARAM.help: Match only packets on a given port number

PARAM.name: gt
PARAM.help: Match only packets with a greater port number

PARAM.name: lt
PARAM.help: Match only packets with a lower port number

PARAM.name: range
PARAM.help: Match only packets in the range of port number

PARAM.name: range

PARAM.name: match-all
PARAM.help: Match if all specified flags are present

PARAM.name: match-any
PARAM.help: Match if any specified flag is present

PARAM.name: icmp_type
PARAM.help: Specify value of the ICMP type

PARAM.name: icmp_code
PARAM.help: Specify value of the ICMP code

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to permit or deny packets matching the IP filter.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: If IP address wildcard bits is provided, the IP address is logically-anded in bitwise with the reverse bits of the wildcard bits. For example, 10.10.10.0 0.0.0.255 means the addresses from 10.10.10.0 to 10.10.10.255 are matched.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to delete an IP filter with sequence number 10 from an IP ACL. Switch(config)# ip access-list testacl Switch(config-acl-testacl)# 10 permit src-ip 10.10.10.0 0.0.0.255

COMMAND.name: no sequence-num
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to delete a filter from IP ACL.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to delete a filter from IP ACL.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to delete an IP filter with sequence number 10 from an IP ACL. Switch(config-acl-testacl)# no sequence-num 10

COMMAND.name: ip access-list

PARAM.name: acl_name
PARAM.help: Specify a IP access-list name, up to 20 characters

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to apply IP ACL to interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to apply IP ACL to interface, the IP ACL should be created first.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to apply IP ACL to interface. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-2 Switch(config-if-eth-0-2)# ip access-list testacl in

COMMAND.name: no ip access-list
COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "${direct_sub}" == "in" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/interface/${iface}/igs_acl/"" else cdbctl update/cdb/interface/${iface}/egs_acl/"" fi;
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to remove IP ACL from interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to remove IP ACL to interface, IP ACL need not to be specified.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to apply IP ACL to interface. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-2 Switch(config-if-eth-0-2)# no ip access-list in

COMMAND.name: show time-range
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to show the information of time-range.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: If no time range are specified, all time-ranges in the system should be show.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to display the information of all the time ranges: Switch# show time-range time-range a absolute start 01:02:03 Sep 28 2016 end 02:03:04 Sep 29 2016 time-range my-time-range absolute start 11:20:30 Sep 28 2016 end 20:30:40 Sep 30 2016 Switch#

COMMAND.name: show time-range info

PARAM.name: timerange_name
PARAM.help: Name of time range info to show

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to show the applied ace on the time range information.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to display the applied ace on the time range information: Switch# show time-range info a time-range a ip access-list a sequence-num 10

COMMAND.name: show ip access-list

PARAM.name: acl_name
PARAM.help: Specify a IP access-list name, up to 20 characters

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to show the configuration of IP ACL .
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: Switch# show ip access-list ip access-list testacl 10 permit src-ip 10.10.10.0 0.0.0.255 Switch# show ip access-list testacl ip access-list testacl 10 permit src-ip 10.10.10.0 0.0.0.255

COMMAND.name: show statistic ip access-list
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to show statistic IP access list.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to show statistic IP access list, interface need to be specified.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: Switch# show statistic ip access-list eth-0-2 ip access-list testacl in 10 permit src-ip 0.10.10.10 255.0.0.0 ( bytes 64 packets 1 ) (total bytes 64 total packets 1 )

COMMAND.name: clear statistic ip access-list
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to clear statistic IP access list.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to clear statistic IP access list in or out or both.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: Switch# clear statistic ip access-list both eth-0-2 Switch# show statistic ip access-list eth-0-2 ip access-list testacl 10 permit src-ip 10.10.10.0 0.0.0.255 ( bytes 64 packets 1 ) (total bytes 64 total packets 1 )
